comments.body: Does the defaulting pass get invoked on the update path, or do you verify equality of the two representations?

I hope v1beta1 isn't around for too much longer, but is the expected behavior for v1beta1 documented somewhere?
- endpoints created via v1beta1 and converted to v1beta3
- endpoints created via v1beta3 and converted to v1beta1
Added comments to v1b[12] about logic if one or the other type of endpoints are provided
Just check whether NodeLegacyHostIP exists or not here.

Nope.  In the relentless goal of a dumber, I mean SIMPLER grammar, Go has done away with the idea of an lvalue and just has a "name" token.  ep.Port is not a name.  There's a bug open against go to allow this syntax, but it's at least a year old and not fixed.
I think this approach could cause labels from different objects to collide. Note that it's not just pods that need this. See pkg/registry/event/rest.go for another example.
Added apiResource in addition to the apiversion as discussed.

Could you please add:

```
// TODO: This is evil. We should change bindings to write DesiredState.Host.
```
I think I convinced Brian that we don't need to sprinkle TODOs for this :)
Thanks :)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1300,1304 @@				return "name", value, nil
			case "DesiredState.Host":
				return "Status.Host", value, nil
			case "DesiredState.Status":
				podStatus := PodStatus(value)

comments.body:
OMG this seems error-prone. 

Could we use reflection to automatically convert all fields that are present in both in and out?

I don't want to block this PR on addressing this, but please add a TODO.

@thockin @smarterclayton Any ideas about how we could automate this?
+1. This is error prone and makes extending Containers struct tricky. I am all ears for a better approaches to handling this conversion logic. Happy to implement a better solution as well.
Comments about which case each conversion was would be super-helpful.
Done
This is different from other funcs above.  Is it correct, and if so does it deserve a comment?
I am not sure what is different in your view, but I believe it's correct
Shouldn't this be PodStatus rather than PodSpec?
Ditto.

Legacy- that's v1beta1 and 2

> On Dec 12, 2014, at 8:19 PM, bgrant0607 notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> In pkg/api/v1beta1/conversion.go:
> 
> > @@ -194,6 +194,18 @@ func init() {
> >             out.PodIP = in.PodIP
> >             return nil
> >         },
> > -       func(in *newer.PodSpec, out *PodState, s conversion.Scope) error {
> > -           if err := s.Convert(&in, &out.Manifest, 0); err != nil {
> > -               return err
> > -           }
> > -           return nil
> > -       },
> > -       func(in *PodState, out *newer.PodSpec, s conversion.Scope) error {
> >   Ditto.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.

Instead of conv function consider:

```
newer.Scheme.AddStructFieldConversion(string(""), "Status", string(""), "Condition")
newer.Scheme.AddStructFieldConversion(string(""), "Condition", string(""), "Status")
```

I'm not 100% sure it's better. I have a change in the pipeline that will allow asserting parent type to avoid accidentally making this transformation to another type.

Does that actually work?  I tried it, but I may have done the wrong thing (I tried to use PodStatus / PodCondition and those failed)

>

Can we go further and add a reciprocal  function or flag, so you cut the LOC of these cases in half?
hm-- this is asking for a subtle bug if another field gets added to Status. I guess our fuzz test will catch it.

Yeah, round trip should catch all of these things (although I'll double check that our initialization doesn't hide that).  We're not protected today from making a field round-trippable (adding it to the old api) but the fuzzer just nils it each time.  A negative round trip test should be done... but it's a lot of work.
